channel.title: Integrated Cognitive User Assistance (ICU)
channel.description: Recent content on Integrated Cognitive User Assistance (ICU)

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Download & Install You can verify your installation by running ICU with the following command: python3 -m ICU This will run the system with the default configuration. Options To see all available command line options: python3 -m icu -help

item.title: Szonya Durant
item.description: Senior Lecturer in the Department of Psychology at Royal Holloway, University of London. Visual neuroscientist with expertise in eye tracking and computational approaches for describing human perception and attention.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Many aspects of the ICU can be configured in the config.json file. General Configuration screen_full (bool) - full screen the ICU window (ignores other screen options). Default: False screen_aspect (tuple) - fix the aspect ratio of the ICU window.

item.title: Benedict Wilkins
item.description: Doctoral researcher in the Department of Computing (2018-2022) at Royal Holloway University of London. Expertise in AI, machine learing & agent systems.

item.title: Events
item.description: TODO this needs updating An event is a small packet of data that when processed causes some change in state. All events have the following attributes: id (str) : the unique id of the event.

item.title: Advanced
item.description: It is possible to interact with ICU via process communication. An external (Python) process can communicate with ICU via events and a shared memory object. Inter-process Communication TODO - for now see the file test/test_external.

item.title: Emanuele Uliana
item.description: Doctoral researcher in the Department of Computing at Royal Holloway University of London. Expertise in security and agent systems.

item.title: Callum Woods
item.description: Doctoral researcher in the Department of Psychology at Royal Holloway University of London. Expertise in eye tracking and machine learning methods.
